a.title: Go to Faulkton Area School District 24-4

div.style: position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; z-index: 100001; background-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); opacity: 0.5; display: none;

span.span:
Faulkton Area School District 24-4
1114 Court St.
PO Box 308
Faulkton, SD 57438
Phone Number: 605-598-6266
Fax: 605-598-6267

div.p: Faulkton Area School District great faculty of ambitious teachers are ready to give its students the best school experience.

In order to meet the needs of 21st century learning trends, our Learning Center offers modern STEAM programs that will ensure that you can become a successful member of our increasingly technologically-enabled society.

span.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 24px; color: blue;

strong.span: The Faulkton Area School District will be CLOSED through the end of the school year.

span.span: School facilities (including the new gym and weight room) will be OFF LIMITS to the public during this time.

span.strong: Click the Links Below For The FASD Food Service RFP

a.title: link to fsmc rfp schedule of events
Link to food service management company rfp document

span.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 24px; color: blue;

p.span: With the construction and remodel of Faulkton Elementary and Faulkton High Schools, our Faulkton Elementary Student Council would like to update our Veteran’s Day Hero display. We would like to create a digital display that can be viewed by visitors in the new high school foyer. In order to make this display, we are again welcoming you to honor any family members or friends who have served or are currently serving in any branch of the military.

strong.span: If you have submitted this information in the past, we are asking that you send it again via email so it can be made into a digital display.

p.span: Please send the following information and a picture to:

li.span: Years served (3 years, or 1939-1942, or WWII, Vietnam, Korean War etc.)
Relation to Student (Example: Grandfather of Samuel Melius)
Attach a picture of the veteran (in military dress if possible) ***Please make sure the picture is of high quality if using a scanned image.

p.span: ***If you are unable to send the information via email, please fill out the information on a separate sheet with a picture of the veteran and return it to Kathleen Melius at Faulkton Elementary before April 1st. We will scan the picture and return it to you as soon as possible (usually within one day of receiving it.)

span.style: font-size: 16pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: blue;

p.span: Thank you for helping us honor those who serve our country.
4th Grade Members-Cash Edgar, Max Martinmaas, Anika Mueller, Austina Sorensen
5th Grade Members-Alex Toay, Sean Roseland, Korbin Stark, Landon Dikoff
6th Grade Members-Spencer Melius, Jasmyn Hawkinson, Thomas Summers, Drake Mueller

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 10px; color: windowtext;

span.span: In accordance with Federal civil rights law and U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) civil rights regulations and policies, the USDA, its Agencies, offices, and employees, and institutions participating in or administering USDA programs are prohibited from discriminating based on race, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, or reprisal or retaliation for prior civil rights activity in any program or activity conducted or funded by USDA.

Persons with disabilities who require alternative means of communication for program information (e.g. Braille, large print, audiotape, American Sign Language, etc.), should contact the Agency (State or local) where they applied for benefits. Individuals who are deaf, hard of hearing or have speech disabilities may contact USDA through the Federal Relay Service at (800) 877-8339. Additionally, program information may be made available in languages other than English.
To file a program complaint of discrimination, complete the USDA Program Discrimination Complaint Form, (AD-3027) found online at:

a.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: 0.3px; background-color: white;

span.strong: , and at any USDA office, or write a letter addressed to USDA and provide in the letter all of the information requested in the form. To request a copy of the complaint form, call (866) 632-9992. Submit your completed form or letter to
